OrgStatisticsREST Resource

Endpoints for retrieving high level statistics.

GET /orgs/{org_id}/stats/incidents_by_category

Gets an incident type name to incident info multimap. These are incidents that were created during the period.

Request Parameters
name type description default constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.    
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.    
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.    
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.    
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.    
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

    
org_id path The organization ID.   int
end_date query   long
offset query 0 int
period_type query    
start_date query   long
user query   int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json StatisticsIncidentDTO (JSON) A map containing the incident type name as a key. The value portion of the map is an array of statisticsIncidentDTO.

GET /orgs/{org_id}/stats/closed_incidents_by_duration

Gets a duration name to closed incident info multimap.

Request Parameters
name type description default constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.    
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.    
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.    
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.    
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.    
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

    
org_id path The organization ID.   int
end_date query   long
offset query 0 int
period_type query    
start_date query   long
user query   int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json StatisticsIncidentDTO (JSON) A map whose key portion is the duration name (e.g. "Between 1 week and 1 month", "Between 1 and 6 months", etc.). The value portion contains all the incidents that were closed within that duration bucket.

GET /orgs/{org_id}/stats/open_incidents_by_confirmed_unconfirmed

Gets the open incidents grouped by whether they are confirmed or unconfirmed.

name type description default constraints

GET /orgs/{org_id}/stats/counts

Gets statistics about the incident and user counts for the org.

Request Parameters
name type description default constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.    
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.    
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.    
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.    
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.    
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

    
org_id path The organization ID.   int
end_date query   long
offset query 0 int
period_type query    
simulations query true if you want to include simulations. false boolean
start_date query   long
user query   int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type
application/json StatisticalCountsDTO (JSON)
